meanings.definition: The act of reigniting or being reignited.
meanings.sent1: The reignition of the candle brought light back to the room.
meanings.sent2: The reignition of the engine was a relief after it had stalled.
meanings.sent3: The reignition of the campfire made everyone cheer for s'mores.
meanings.sent4: The reignition of hope in her heart was like a burst of fireworks.
meanings.sent5: The reignition of the old friendship was heartwarming and joyful.

meanings.definition: The process of starting a fire or flame again.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the reignition of the bonfire was challenging.
meanings.sent2: The reignition of the match brought warmth to the cold room.
meanings.sent3: The reignition of the grill made the barbecue even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: The reignition of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The reignition of the hearth brought comfort on a chilly evening.

meanings.definition: The renewal or revival of something that has faded or diminished.
meanings.sent1: The reignition of interest in the project sparked new ideas.
meanings.sent2: The reignition of passion in their relationship was like a fresh start.
meanings.sent3: The reignition of the old car made it feel young again.
meanings.sent4: The reignition of the music scene brought back nostalgia for many.
meanings.sent5: The reignition of the painting's colors made it vibrant once more.
